helperspkg

Class ArgHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • helperspkg.ArgHandler

  • public abstract class ArgHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is basically your regular old static methods class used to keep the main class looking nice and streamlined.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArgHandler

        public ArgHandler()

    • Method Detail

      • handleInclusion

        public static void handleInclusion(java.lang.String inclusionFile)
        This method handles the Inclusion list that may be passed on the argument list. It makes sure that only patients in the Inclusion file are available in the main.ptAvail list. NOTE that inclusion in the inclusion file does not mean that the patient will be included. The exclusion list, pt list, and compare pt list all play a roll in this. Dependency: FHandler.readIntFromAscii Fails the program if the inclusion file has no patients, doesn't open,etc.
        Parameters:
        inclusionFile - The string name of the argument file.

      • handleExclusion

        public static void handleExclusion(java.lang.String exclusionFile)
        Handles the exclusion file. This makes sure that no patient ID in this file is found in the main.ptAvail list. Dependency: FHandler.readIntFromAscii Fails on: invalid file.
        Parameters:
        exclusionFile - The string name of the exclusion file.

      • createSearchContainers

        public static void createSearchContainers(java.lang.String arg1)
        This method creates the searchContainers for the case patients that need matches. Creates the main.ptAvail and sclist. Adjusts the size of needs if there are not enough patients to accommodate the requested number of matches. Note that this number is checked and possibly adjusted again after the inclusion and exclusion. Fails on: inaccessible file, no patients in file, ptList not yet created.
        Parameters:
        arg1 - The string name for the file containing the list of case patients.

      • openOutFile

        public static java.io.BufferedWriter openOutFile(java.lang.String arg4)
        Creates the buffered writer for the output file.
        Parameters:
        arg4 - The string name of the file we will be writing to.
        Returns:
        The BufferedWriter to write to.

      • openLevels

        public static LevelHolder openLevels()
        Opens an existing levels.dat folder IF it exists and loads it. Otherwise we get a new LevelHolder.
        Returns:
        A LevelHolder to be used with the import.

      • loadNewInputThrottled

        public static void loadNewInputThrottled(java.lang.String inputFile,
                                         boolean saveSummary)
        This depreciated the "loadNewInput" function because throttling it worked so much better! Memory was halved and it even ran a bit faster. Fails on: the inputFile cannot be opened or read.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - The string name of the file of patients to load.
        saveSummary - Whether or not to save a summary of this file. The saving of the summary takes a while.

      • loadSummaries

        public static void loadSummaries()
        Loads an existing summary file.

      • levelInclusion

        public static void levelInclusion(LevelHolder e,
                                  java.lang.String f)
        This allows you to say" Include only THESE levels. Note: This is likely to be refined in the future... Really should have a way of applying regular expressions to the levels to generate this inclusion/exclusion list for a particular level file. OR a way to code the levels with regular expressions.
        Parameters:
        e - The levelHolder of levels we'll pull from to match the levels in f.
        f - A string containing the name of a file where the levels we want to include are stored.

      • levelExclusion

        public static void levelExclusion(LevelHolder e,
                                  java.lang.String f)
        This allows you to exclude levels. NOTE: Like levelInclusion the Exclusion is likely to change as we use regular expressions or at least provide the option to use regular expressions to help with inclusion and exclusion.
        Parameters:
        e - The level Holder form which we will be excluding the levels found in f.
        f - A string containing the name of the file where the exclusion levels are stored.
